name: sdks/expressjs/utils/DELETE handler

12ea6c09-9619-4973-95f6-abe689e41733.name: app ID
12ea6c09-9619-4973-95f6-abe689e41733.description:
The id of the express instance.

Example: 
"my-express-server"

046d2366-7527-443f-a159-a4b39688bdbc.name: route
046d2366-7527-443f-a159-a4b39688bdbc.description:
Receives the route(s) to handle requests for. Route be specified as exact match (1) or as pattern match (2).

Example:
1) "/status" will just match "/status"
2) "/s*s" will match "status", "shoes", etc..

457d040f-5a95-4c60-82fa-fef0e38760af.name: status
457d040f-5a95-4c60-82fa-fef0e38760af.description:
Receives the HTTP status code to be sent with the response to the client.

Example: 
200

f853ca3a-b0b5-449c-9a9f-fe12c899c87a.name: headers

8a8b7743-0dd7-406d-9061-c75c3f783402.name: body
8a8b7743-0dd7-406d-9061-c75c3f783402.description:
Receives the content to send to the client as response body.

Example:
- "OK"
- 3.14
- { "status": "OK" }

4a0a92b2-df33-4ed1-b1bf-3a6c7b9ae48a.name: headers

fee28aae-da02-4db3-8260-88f8502cfe42.name: body
fee28aae-da02-4db3-8260-88f8502cfe42.description:
Forwards the body of the request to be processed.

Example:
- "OK"
- 3.14
- { "status": "OK" }

10e72cfe-7f85-47de-9bdd-7d2e66a9b8a4.name: done
10e72cfe-7f85-47de-9bdd-7d2e66a9b8a4.description: Event triggered when the request has been processed.

description:
Receives DELETE requests on the specified route and dispatches the corresponding response.

Example:
1. "my-express-server"@0 received on `app ID`
2. "/users/"@0 received on `route`
3. a client DELETE request received by express with URL "http://api.mydomain.com/users/2
4. the following signals are sent to other node(s) processing the request
- {
 "accept": "application/json"
}@0 sent on `headers`
- {}@0 sent `body`
5. The following signals are received back from processing nodes and sent out to the client:
- 200@0 on `status`,
- {
    "content-type": "application/json" 
  }@0 on `headers`,
-  { id:2, "name": "John Doe", "age": 29 }@0 on `body`
6. null@0 sent on `done`
